title: Navalny’s legacy
description: The death of Vladimir Putin's largest opponent, Alexei Navalny, has rocked hopes of democracy in Russia. We speak with The Post's David M. Herszenhorn, who covered Navalny in Russia, about the impact of his death and Putin's tightening grip on power.

title: Bullet-riddled body found in Spain was Russian defector, Ukraine says
description: Maksym Kuzminov flew a Russian military helicopter into Ukraine to defect with great fanfare last year. Pro-government Russians bloggers have celebrated the killing.

title: What to know about Yulia Navalnaya as she vows to take on Vladimir Putin
description: The widow of the Russian political opposition leader Alexei Navalny declared that she will continue her husband’s fight for democracy after he died suddenly in prison.

title: Navalny’s mother, in video, pleads with Putin to release her son’s body
description: Lyudmila Navalnaya traveled to the Artic prison where her son, Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny, died, but investigators have refused to release his body.

title: What to know about Julian Assange’s extradition case ahead of U.K. hearing
description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange’s fight to avoid extradition to the United States to face spying charges may be nearing an end.

title: Los Angeles woman arrested on treason charge in Russia’s Yekaterinburg
description: She was arrested in the same city as Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich and accused of aiding Ukraine, but it’s unclear when or why she returned to Russia.

title: Wife of Haiti’s assassinated president accused of complicity in his killing
description: A Haitian judge indicted 51 people for their alleged roles in the 2021 assassination of President Jovenel Moïse, including his wife, Martine Moïse.

title: Middle East conflict live updates: Palestinian U.N. envoy urges ICJ to rule Israeli occupation illegal
description: The representative said during public hearings that an International Court of Justice ruling could contribute to “paving the way to just and lasting peace.”

title: Cargo ship forced to evacuate after Houthi missile attack off Yemen
description: A missile hit and damaged the U.K.-registered MV Rubymar in the Gulf of Aden, causing the crew to issue a distress call and abandon ship, the U.S. military said.
